awd_titl_txt: II-NEW: GPU Cluster for Computing Research
awd_abstract_narration:
This project is for the acquisition of a GPU cluster dedicated to research on High Performance Computing. The selected infrastructure (a cluster of GPUs) presents itself as a serious candidate for the future of High Performance Computing. Indeed, the theoretical cost efficiency(GFlop/sec/dollar) and the theoretical power efficiency (GFlop/sec/Watt) scores very high compared to current other high performance computing platforms.  However, two huge challenges are whether relevant application codes can reach a reasonable fraction of the peak of these computing platforms and how to reach this performance level. The PIs collaborative effort answers these research questions from various angles. The proposed infrastructure is supporting their research on these issues.

The codes produced by this collaborative effort are included in well-known software packages (LAPACK, NVIDIA CUBLAS, ScaLAPACK, WRF).
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

inst.inst_name: University of Colorado at Denver-Downtown Campus

perf_inst.perf_inst_name: University of Colorado at Denver-Downtown Campus

por.por_cntn:
This award sponsored the acquisition of a GPU cluster dedicated to research on High Performance Computing. The acquired cluster, "colibri", is made of 24 nodes each equipped with two CPUs ( Intel Xeon E5-2670 Sandy Bridge ) and two NVIDIA Fermi GPUs ( Tesla M2090 ), connected by Infiniband ( InfiniBand 4X QDR ). The theoritical peak performance of the colibri cluster is 40 TFlop/s. (40 TFlop/s = 32 TFlop/s from the 48 GPU plus 8 TFlop/s from the 48 CPU). The colibri cluster is up and running since its purchase (2012) in the machine room in the basement of the science building at the University of Colorado Denver. 

This infrastruture is a critical resource for the University of Colorado Denver. It has been and is instrumental in advancing the state-of-the-art of research in several ways. Users have been exploring communication optimal algorithms on the proposed infrastructure, users have been researching on dense linear algebra for heterogeneous clusters of CPUs/GPUs. This infrastrcuture is used to develop and enable new research results.

This infrastruture is instrumental in helping with the development of well-known software packages (LAPACK, ScaLAPACK, WRF) which are high quality software with open source access. A number of professional, scientists, graduates, and undergraduates have gained theoretical and practical knowledge through the educational activities (classes, seminars, PhD thesis) enabled by the proposed infrastructure.


Last Modified: 04/17/2015
Modified by: Julien Langou

Image
